trans-unit.source: Common DocumentDB use cases | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Common DocumentDB use cases | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the top five use cases for DocumentDB: user generated content, event logging, catalog data, user preferences data, and Internet of Things (IoT).
trans-unit.target: Learn about the top five use cases for DocumentDB: user generated content, event logging, catalog data, user preferences data, and Internet of Things (IoT).

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of several common use cases for DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of several common use cases for DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: The recommendations in this article serve as a starting point as you develop your application with DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: The recommendations in this article serve as a starting point as you develop your application with DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: After reading this article, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: After reading this article, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: What are the common use cases for DocumentDB?
trans-unit.target: What are the common use cases for DocumentDB?

trans-unit.source: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a user generated content store?
trans-unit.target: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a user generated content store?

trans-unit.source: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a catalog data store?
trans-unit.target: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a catalog data store?

trans-unit.source: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a event log store?
trans-unit.target: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a event log store?

trans-unit.source: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a user preferences data store?
trans-unit.target: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a user preferences data store?

trans-unit.source: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a data store for Internet of Things (IoT) systems?
trans-unit.target: What are the benefits of using DocumentDB as a data store for Internet of Things (IoT) systems?

trans-unit.source: A common use case for DocumentDB is to store and query user generated content (UGC) for web and mobile applications, particularly social media applications.
trans-unit.target: A common use case for DocumentDB is to store and query user generated content (UGC) for web and mobile applications, particularly social media applications.

trans-unit.source: Some examples of UGC are chat sessions, tweets, blog posts, ratings, and comments.
trans-unit.target: Some examples of UGC are chat sessions, tweets, blog posts, ratings, and comments.

trans-unit.source: Often, the UGC in social media applications is a blend of free form text, properties, tags and relationships that are not bounded by rigid structure.
trans-unit.target: Often, the UGC in social media applications is a blend of free form text, properties, tags and relationships that are not bounded by rigid structure.

trans-unit.source: Content such as chats, comments, and posts can be stored in DocumentDB without requiring transformations or complex object to relational mapping layers.
trans-unit.target: Content such as chats, comments, and posts can be stored in DocumentDB without requiring transformations or complex object to relational mapping layers.

trans-unit.source: Data properties can be added or modified easily to match requirements as developers iterate over the application code, thus promoting rapid development.
trans-unit.target: Data properties can be added or modified easily to match requirements as developers iterate over the application code, thus promoting rapid development.

trans-unit.source: Applications that integrate with various social networks must respond to changing schemas from these networks.
trans-unit.target: Applications that integrate with various social networks must respond to changing schemas from these networks.

trans-unit.source: As data is automatically indexed by default in DocumentDB, data is ready to be queried at any time.
trans-unit.target: As data is automatically indexed by default in DocumentDB, data is ready to be queried at any time.

trans-unit.source: Hence, these applications have the flexibility to retrieve projections as per their respective needs.
trans-unit.target: Hence, these applications have the flexibility to retrieve projections as per their respective needs.

trans-unit.source: Many of the social applications run at global scale and can exhibit unpredictable usage patterns.
trans-unit.target: Many of the social applications run at global scale and can exhibit unpredictable usage patterns.

trans-unit.source: Flexibility in scaling the data store is essential as the application layer scales to match usage demand.
trans-unit.target: Flexibility in scaling the data store is essential as the application layer scales to match usage demand.

trans-unit.source: You can scale out by adding additional data partitions under a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: You can scale out by adding additional data partitions under a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can also create additional DocumentDB accounts across multiple regions.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can also create additional DocumentDB accounts across multiple regions.

trans-unit.source: For DocumentDB service region availability, see <linkText>Azure Regions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For DocumentDB service region availability, see <linkText>Azure Regions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Catalog data usage scenarios involve storing and querying a set of attributes for entities such as people, places and products.
trans-unit.target: Catalog data usage scenarios involve storing and querying a set of attributes for entities such as people, places and products.

trans-unit.source: Some examples of catalog data are user accounts, product catalogs, device registries for IoT, and bill of materials systems.
trans-unit.target: Some examples of catalog data are user accounts, product catalogs, device registries for IoT, and bill of materials systems.

trans-unit.source: Attributes for this data may vary and can change over time to fit application requirements.
trans-unit.target: Attributes for this data may vary and can change over time to fit application requirements.

trans-unit.source: Consider an example of a product catalog for an automotive parts supplier.
trans-unit.target: Consider an example of a product catalog for an automotive parts supplier.

trans-unit.source: Every part may have its own attributes in addition to the common attributes that all parts share.
trans-unit.target: Every part may have its own attributes in addition to the common attributes that all parts share.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, attributes for a specific part can change the following year when a new model is released.
trans-unit.target: Furthermore, attributes for a specific part can change the following year when a new model is released.

trans-unit.source: As a JSON document store, DocumentDB supports flexible schemas and allows you to represent data with nested properties, and thus it is well suited for storing product catalog data.
trans-unit.target: As a JSON document store, DocumentDB supports flexible schemas and allows you to represent data with nested properties, and thus it is well suited for storing product catalog data.

trans-unit.source: Application logging is often emitted in large volumes and may have varying attributes based on the deployed application version or the component logging events.
trans-unit.target: Application logging is often emitted in large volumes and may have varying attributes based on the deployed application version or the component logging events.

trans-unit.source: Log data is not bounded by complex relationships or rigid structures.
trans-unit.target: Log data is not bounded by complex relationships or rigid structures.

trans-unit.source: Increasingly, log data is persisted in JSON format since JSON is lightweight and easy for humans to read.
trans-unit.target: Increasingly, log data is persisted in JSON format since JSON is lightweight and easy for humans to read.

trans-unit.source: There are typically two major use cases related to event log data.
trans-unit.target: There are typically two major use cases related to event log data.

trans-unit.source: The first use case is to perform ad-hoc queries over a subset of data for troubleshooting.
trans-unit.target: The first use case is to perform ad-hoc queries over a subset of data for troubleshooting.

trans-unit.source: During troubleshooting, a subset of data is first retrieved from the logs, typically by time series.
trans-unit.target: During troubleshooting, a subset of data is first retrieved from the logs, typically by time series.

trans-unit.source: Then, a drill-down is performed by filtering the dataset with error levels or error messages.
trans-unit.target: Then, a drill-down is performed by filtering the dataset with error levels or error messages.

trans-unit.source: This is where storing event logs in DocumentDB is an advantage.
trans-unit.target: This is where storing event logs in DocumentDB is an advantage.

trans-unit.source: Log data stored in DocumentDB is automatically indexed by default, and thus it is ready to be queried at any time.
trans-unit.target: Log data stored in DocumentDB is automatically indexed by default, and thus it is ready to be queried at any time.

trans-unit.source: In addition, log data can be persisted across data partitions as a time-series.
trans-unit.target: In addition, log data can be persisted across data partitions as a time-series.

trans-unit.source: Older logs can be rolled out to cold storage per your retention policy.
trans-unit.target: Older logs can be rolled out to cold storage per your retention policy.

trans-unit.source: The second use case involves long running data analytics jobs performed offline over a large volume of log data.
trans-unit.target: The second use case involves long running data analytics jobs performed offline over a large volume of log data.

trans-unit.source: Examples of this use case include server availability analysis, application error analysis, and clickstream data analysis.
trans-unit.target: Examples of this use case include server availability analysis, application error analysis, and clickstream data analysis.

trans-unit.source: Typically, Hadoop is used to perform these types of analyses.
trans-unit.target: Typically, Hadoop is used to perform these types of analyses.

trans-unit.source: With the Hadoop Connector for DocumentDB, DocumentDB databases function as data sources and sinks for Pig, Hive and Map/Reduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: With the Hadoop Connector for DocumentDB, DocumentDB databases function as data sources and sinks for Pig, Hive and Map/Reduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: For details on the Hadoop Connector for DocumentDB, see <linkText>Run a Hadoop job with DocumentDB and HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on the Hadoop Connector for DocumentDB, see <linkText>Run a Hadoop job with DocumentDB and HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Nowadays, most modern web and mobile applications come with complex views and experiences.
trans-unit.target: Nowadays, most modern web and mobile applications come with complex views and experiences.

trans-unit.source: These views and experiences are usually dynamic, catering to user preferences or moods and branding needs.
trans-unit.target: These views and experiences are usually dynamic, catering to user preferences or moods and branding needs.

trans-unit.source: Hence, applications need to be able to retrieve personalized settings effectively in order to render UI elements and experiences quickly.
trans-unit.target: Hence, applications need to be able to retrieve personalized settings effectively in order to render UI elements and experiences quickly.

trans-unit.source: JSON is an effective format to represent UI layout data as it is not only lightweight, but also can be easily interpreted by JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: JSON is an effective format to represent UI layout data as it is not only lightweight, but also can be easily interpreted by JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB offers tunable consistency levels that allow fast reads with low latency writes.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB offers tunable consistency levels that allow fast reads with low latency writes.

trans-unit.source: Hence, storing UI layout data including personalized settings as JSON documents in DocumentDB is an effective means to get this data across the wire.
trans-unit.target: Hence, storing UI layout data including personalized settings as JSON documents in DocumentDB is an effective means to get this data across the wire.

trans-unit.source: IoT use cases commonly share some patterns in how they ingest, process and store data.
trans-unit.target: IoT use cases commonly share some patterns in how they ingest, process and store data.

trans-unit.source: First, these systems allow for data intake that can ingest bursts of data from device sensors of various locales.
trans-unit.target: First, these systems allow for data intake that can ingest bursts of data from device sensors of various locales.

trans-unit.source: Next, these systems process and analyze streaming data to derive real time insights.
trans-unit.target: Next, these systems process and analyze streaming data to derive real time insights.

trans-unit.source: And last but not least, most if not all data will eventually land in a data store for adhoc querying and offline analytics.
trans-unit.target: And last but not least, most if not all data will eventually land in a data store for adhoc querying and offline analytics.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure offers rich services that can be leveraged for IoT use cases.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure offers rich services that can be leveraged for IoT use cases.

trans-unit.source: Azure IoT services are a set of services including Azure Event Hubs, Azure DocumentDB, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Notification Hub, Azure Machine Learning, Azure HDInsight, and PowerBI.
trans-unit.target: Azure IoT services are a set of services including Azure Event Hubs, Azure DocumentDB, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Notification Hub, Azure Machine Learning, Azure HDInsight, and PowerBI.

trans-unit.source: Bursts of data can be ingested by Azure Event Hubs as it offers high throughput data ingestion with low latency.
trans-unit.target: Bursts of data can be ingested by Azure Event Hubs as it offers high throughput data ingestion with low latency.

trans-unit.source: Data ingested that needs to be processed for real time insight can be funneled to Azure Stream Analytics for real time analytics.
trans-unit.target: Data ingested that needs to be processed for real time insight can be funneled to Azure Stream Analytics for real time analytics.

trans-unit.source: Data can be loaded into DocumentDB for adhoc querying.
trans-unit.target: Data can be loaded into DocumentDB for adhoc querying.

trans-unit.source: Once the data is loaded into DocumentDB, the data is ready to be queried.
trans-unit.target: Once the data is loaded into DocumentDB, the data is ready to be queried.

trans-unit.source: The data in DocumentDB can be used as reference data as part of real time analytics.
trans-unit.target: The data in DocumentDB can be used as reference data as part of real time analytics.

trans-unit.source: In addtion, data can further be refined and processed by connecting DocumentDB data to HDInsight for Pig, Hive or Map/Reduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: In addtion, data can further be refined and processed by connecting DocumentDB data to HDInsight for Pig, Hive or Map/Reduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: Refined data is then loaded back to DocumentDB for reporting.
trans-unit.target: Refined data is then loaded back to DocumentDB for reporting.

trans-unit.source: For a sample IoT solution using DocumentDB, EventHubs and Storm, see the <linkText>hdinsight-storm-examples repository on GitHub</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a sample IoT solution using DocumentDB, EventHubs and Storm, see the <linkText>hdinsight-storm-examples repository on GitHub</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on Azure offerings for IoT, see <linkText>Create the Internet of Your Things</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Azure offerings for IoT, see <linkText>Create the Internet of Your Things</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To get started with DocumentDB, you can create an <linkText>account</linkText><title></title> and then follow our <linkText>learning guide</linkText><title></title> to learn about DocumentDB and find the information you need.
trans-unit.target: To get started with DocumentDB, you can create an <linkText>account</linkText><title></title> and then follow our <linkText>learning guide</linkText><title></title> to learn about DocumentDB and find the information you need.

trans-unit.source: Or, if you'd like to read more about customers using DocumentDB, the following customer stories are available:
trans-unit.target: Or, if you'd like to read more about customers using DocumentDB, the following customer stories are available:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Breeze</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Breeze</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Leading Integrator Gives Multinational Firms Global Insight in Minutes with Flexible Cloud Technologies.
trans-unit.target: Leading Integrator Gives Multinational Firms Global Insight in Minutes with Flexible Cloud Technologies.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>News Republic</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>News Republic</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Adding intelligence to the news to provide information with purpose for engaged citizens.
trans-unit.target: Adding intelligence to the news to provide information with purpose for engaged citizens.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SGS International</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SGS International</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For consistent color across the globe, major brands turn to SGS.
trans-unit.target: For consistent color across the globe, major brands turn to SGS.

trans-unit.source: And SGS turns to Azure.
trans-unit.target: And SGS turns to Azure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Telenor</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Telenor</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Global leader Telenor uses the cloud to move with the speed of a startup.
trans-unit.target: Global leader Telenor uses the cloud to move with the speed of a startup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>XOMNI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>XOMNI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The store of the future runs on speedy search and the easy flow of data.
trans-unit.target: The store of the future runs on speedy search and the easy flow of data.
